result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:42 PM Defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik appeared by phone.  Attorney Nathan T Oswald in court for Dylon Ryan Okrzesik.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Connection issues with the defendant appearing via phone.
Court is unable to get a response from the defendant.
Court questions Atty Oswald where his client is.
Atty Oswald states that his client is appearing via ZOOM and would ask that the hearing be rescheduled.
ADA Pfeil would ask that the defendant appear in person for the Adjourned Initial Appearance.
Court informs the defendant that he will need to appear in person and if he fails to appear a warrant will be issued for his arrest.
State is in compliance with victim rights legislation and no victims appear today.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

2:05 PM Defendant Dylon Ryan Okrzesik appeared by video, in custody at the Waushara County Jail.   Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court questions the defendant if he had received the complaint.
Defendant has received the complaint.
Court questions if he will be eligible for public defender representation.
He believes he would be eligible.
Defendant is informed he will need to contact the Public Defender's Office here in Portage County.
Court questions the defendant if he would like to adjourn.
State would ask fora $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated.

BY THE COURT: 
Case is adjourned.
